results.title: Spirit of the Tall Ships
results.brief_description: SPIRIT OF THE TALL SHIPS traces the historical voyage of the Polish Tall Ship, Dar Mlodziezy and the USA Coast Guard’s Egle to Australia, and the adventures of four young Australians who took part in these epic journeys.

results.title: Spirit of the Renaissance
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Barnes
results.brief_description: Explores the intellectual and artistic climate of Florence during the fourteenth and fifteenth centuries using scenes from the daily life of a contemporary Florentine. Discusses the lives and influence of Petrarca, Alberti, Leonardo Da Vinci and Savonarola. Film uses dramatization, contemporary art material with modern day footage of Florence and Rome.

results.title: Spirit of the railway
results.brief_description: This moving documentary provides a personal journey through one of the most significant events in Australia’s history; the construction of the Thai-Burma railway. The railway was built by Australian prisoners of war and other allied and Asian laboueres during World War 2. The video uses personal accounts, forensic and historical footage, most of which hasn’t been seen in America, Australia or Japan. Features artwork by Ronald Searle, Jack Chalker, Ray Parkin and Fred Ransom-Smith.

results.title: Spirit of Progress: Australia's wonder train
results.creator_credit: Victorian Railways, Herschells Films and Charles R. Herschell
results.brief_description: Shows stages of the building of the Spirit of Progress which was designed and built in the Railway Workshops in Newport, Victoria. The train was built for speed, comfort and safety, travelling up to 84 mph. Also shows the launch of her inaugural run to Geelong from Spencer Street Station (Melbourne) attended by the Ppremier of Victoria, Mr A.A. Dunstan, the Prime Minister of Australia, Robert Menzies and Chairman of the Victorian Railways Commissioners, Harold Clapp. Commentary by Terry Dear and photography by Roy Driver.

results.title: Spirit of cognac
results.brief_description: Traditional brandy production, distillation, maturation and distribution in the Cognac district of France. Includes scenes of the celebration at the end of the harvest. Mention is made of producer - Martell.

results.title: Spirit of change: Iran
results.creator_credit: Nihon Hoso Kyokai, UNICEF, Suichi Kikuchi and Masayuki Nakano
results.brief_description: Three young women - Sima Boozani, Rou Shaun and Susan Azardi are peaceful “soldiers” conscripted into Iran’s Army of Knowledge. By teaching reading and writing to young girls and illiterate women in the nation’s remote villages, these young women are quietly ushering in a social revolution in the oldest civilization in the world.

results.title: Spinnolio
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Derek Lamb and John Weldon
results.brief_description: Traditional folklore takes a wry turn in this animated tale about a carved wooden puppet who lacks mobility and human consciousness. Noted for his “cool head” and unruffled personality, the inanimate Spinnolio makes a totally passive, though quite successful go at life, until his employer decides to replace him with a computer. A modern-day fairy tale that smacks of the sardonic and has philosophical implications about the nature of consciousness, the work ethic, interpersonal relationships, and the citizen in society.

results.title: Spinning out
results.creator_credit: Anne Deveson Productions and Anne Deveson
results.brief_description: Spinning Out will help people to understand the human face of a uniquely human disease - schizophrenia. There is no known cause or cure. Schizophrenia has been a puzzle for centuries. One in a hundred people will develop the illness. 25% of these will have a single attack, then recover, but most sufferers experience recurrent tormenting attacks. Anne Deveson, whose own son was schizophrenic, speaks directly to experts on the subject - schizophrenics themselves and their families. We meet Simon, a consumer advocate and artist; Jay, a mathematical physicist and his daughter, Susan, who is also schizophrenic; street kid, Ace; and Bill and Paul who have spent most of their lives in institutions. It is a touching and important film which argues strongly for activism amongst patients, carers and the psychiatric profession. This video is accompanied by an information booklet.
